thread.title: How Gov. Buni's Actions Revive and Accelerate Education in Yobe State
thread.title_full: How Gov. Buni's Actions Revive and Accelerate Education in Yobe State

author: info
title: How Gov. Buni's Actions Revive and Accelerate Education in Yobe State
text:
Education is at the heart of sustainable development, and in Yobe State, deliberate steps are being taken to transform the sector. Governor Mai Mala Buni has placed the revival of basic and secondary education at the top of his priorities, and recent milestones reflect this commitment.
Transforming Education Against All Odds When Governor Buni assumed office, the state was grappling with the devastating effects of insurgency, which left hundreds of schools destroyed and thousands of children displaced. Recognizing the urgent need to restore hope through education, his administration launched a comprehensive reform agenda.
Key Achievements in Yobe’s Education Sector 300 Schools Rescued: Institutions previously affected by insurgency have been rehabilitated and reopened.
627 New Classrooms Built: Expanding access to learning across communities.
448 Classrooms Renovated: Upgrading existing infrastructure to modern standards.
61 Schools Fenced: Enhancing safety and security for learners.
178 Toilet Blocks Constructed: Improving hygiene and sanitation in schools.
35 Solar-Powered Boreholes Drilled: Ensuring access to clean water in learning environments.
Teacher and Student Support 9,452 Teachers Recruited & Supported: Building a strong workforce for quality learning.
2,200 Teachers Trained: Enhancing capacity through workshops and refresher programs.
5,000 Teachers Recruited Recently: Bridging the gap in staffing needs.
233 Beneficiaries of Overseas Scholarship Programmes: Exposing students to global learning opportunities.
40,000 Yobe Students on Annual Scholarship: Encouraging retention and performance.
60,000 Pupils on Conditional Cash Transfers: Supporting families to keep children in school.
Infrastructure and Innovation 14 New Mega and Model Schools: Offering world-class facilities for future leaders.
10 New Girls’ Senior Secondary Schools: Expanding opportunities for girl-child education.
N2.3 Billion Spent on Solar-Powered Electricity: Providing reliable power across 72 schools.
N750 Million Allocated for Almajiri Schools: Mainstreaming vulnerable children into formal education.
85,550 Classroom Furniture Produced: Creating conducive learning spaces.
Commitment to Examinations and Assessments ₦3 Billion Released for WAEC, NECO, NABTEB & NBAIS: Ensuring no child is left behind due to exam fees.
₦2.2 Billion Scholarships: Supporting 890 NTC students for the 2024/2025 academic session.
Celebrating Success The results are beginning to show. Recently, Yobe girls including Nafisa Abdullahi, Ruqayya Muhammad Fema, and Hadiza Kashim Kalli stood out on the global stage, winning recognition at the Global Finals of the Technovation Girls Challenge in London, UK.
Conclusion Governor Mai Mala Buni’s bold and inclusive reforms have brought Yobe’s education sector back to life. With massive investment in infrastructure, human capital, and innovation, Yobe State is not just rebuilding schools—it is rebuilding futures.
The achievements demonstrate that even in regions once ravaged by insurgency, education can thrive with the right leadership and vision.
